message_1: Consider two sets A = {2, 4, 6, 8} and B = {3, 6, 9}. If set C is the intersection of set A and set B, find the value of the smallest element in set C.
message_2: To find the intersection of sets A and B, we look for the elements that are common in both sets. In this case, the only common element is 6. Therefore, set C = {6}. The smallest (and only) element in set C is 6.
